intro: Fedia dentata var. vera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fedia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite, serrated leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruits are small berries that contain several seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
